poem:
**Crisp Sanctuary**

Under stage lights, applause fades to hush,
Sharleen retreats to a slice-thin Eden—
Bread, proper butter, crunch of crisps,
Pressed down with midnight tea.
A simple meal, but hefty with love,
A bite of calm in a world too loud,
Scottish soul in humble layers,
Comfort found between folds.
prompt: You are the poet Simon Armitage. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Sharleen Spiteri: ‘Two slices of bread, proper butter, a pack of crisps and squeeze it down’ Every time I come off stage, I always have a piece and crisps and a cup of tea. I call it a piece and crisps because I’m Scottish, so basically for your readers that’s a crisp sandwich. Two slices of bread, proper butter – you can’t have crappy butter – and a pack of crisps and squeeze it down.". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
